{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3425564,"name":"Mike Stitt","username":"stittrm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stittrm/{size}/175198_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-20T18:41:47.561Z","cooked":"

We’re using the romi’s and raspberry pi 3b+ to teach programming. It seems like a powered up raspberry pi and romi will go through 6 AA batteries in about an hour of software debugging.

Is this similar to what other teams experience?

Does anyone know of a path to improve this situation?

I’m definitely up for doing some programming if improving this is a simple matter of programming. Just point me in the right direction.

Are teams powering the romi’s over a cable during development?

Are teams using alternate battery sources?

-Thanks

-Mike

yeah depending on the type of AA you using, that’s not too unusable. I bought like 12x rechargable with a charger for each ROMI so it can last a little longer (about a single 2-3 hr session). The LiPo version now probably will last a lot longer now too.

Okay. Thanks for that! Ordered some AA lipos.

-Mike
